title: Missionary Work
subtitle: Missionary Work in general
author: Jincheng
description: A forum discussing missionary work in general. You can also find more about the missions of our members oversea.

posts_list.title: Israel and missionary work
posts_list.author: Mose
posts_list.content: What are the specificities  of Israel as a missionary land? Since this is the only Jewish country in the world, with a large muslim minority, how would you approach the missionary work?         What is the percentage of Christians there?

posts_list.title: Reducers
posts_list.author: Francois
posts_list.content: They are useful for sure. But for religion, I'm not sure... That's an open question, I'd say. One should try!

posts_list.title: Korea
posts_list.author: Simon
posts_list.content: Nobody wants to read the bible in czech in Korea. Don't even try.... I've wasted a whole month trying to preach around.

posts_list.title: The first missionary
posts_list.author: Dung
posts_list.content: John. He enjoyed baptizing people. And Peter as well. He became the first vicary of Rome.

posts_list.title: Victor Hugo
posts_list.author: Francois
posts_list.content: Victor Hugo said that god is the Verb, and the Verb is God. Dieu est le verbe et le Verbe c'est dieu. I would encourage everybody to learn French. If you don't find God, at least you can order croissants properly.

posts_list.title: England
posts_list.author: Francois
posts_list.content: To me, England needs a good worship. A lot of things to be forgiven over there.
